message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you a unique opportunity to purchase a high-quality product that I think you'll really appreciate. I'm looking for $150 for it.
I'm interested in the product, but $150 is a bit out of my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $120.
I understand that $120 is a bit lower than what I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer it to you for $135.
I'm getting closer to what I'm comfortable with, but $135 is still a bit steep. I'd be willing to pay $125 for the product.
I'm getting a bit concerned that we're not going to meet in the middle. I'm willing to compromise further, but I need to make sure I get a fair price. I can offer it to you for $130.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $130 is still a bit too high for me. I'd be willing to pay $125 for the product.
It seems like we're stuck in a loop. I'm willing to take a slightly firmer stance, but I'm still open to negotiating. I can offer it to you for $132.50.
I'm still interested in the product, but $132.50 is getting closer to my limit. I'd be willing to pay $127 for the product.
I'm starting to think we're getting close to a deal. I can offer it to you for $130, but that's as low as I'm willing to go.
I really want to make a deal, but $130 is still a bit too high for me. I'd be willing to pay $128 for the product.
